meanings.definition: A series of columns set at regular intervals and usually supporting the base of a roof structure.
meanings.sent1: The ancient building had a beautiful colonnade that held up the roof.
meanings.sent2: Visitors walked under the colonnade to enter the grand hall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the colonnade as a playground, hopping from column to column.
meanings.sent4: The colonnade of trees along the path created a natural tunnel of greenery.
meanings.sent5: The colonnade stood tall and majestic, casting long shadows in the afternoon sun.

meanings.definition: A structure composed of a series of columns typically supporting a roof or entablature.
meanings.sent1: The elegant mansion featured a grand colonnade at its entrance.
meanings.sent2: The colonnade of the ancient temple was adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons perched on the colonnade, enjoying the view from above.
meanings.sent4: The colonnade of support from her friends helped her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The colonnade of pillars created a sense of grandeur and strength in the building.
